byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul; Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan; and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: Taliban suicide attack near Bagram Air base in Afghanistan kills six United States service members, including New York City police detective; US forces remain in country and continue to suffer casualties despite insistence that NATO troops are only advising and training; resurgent Taliban has overwhelmed Afghan forces.
lead_paragraph: A Taliban suicide bomber on a motorcycle struck a patrol near Bagram Air Base, in one of the deadliest attacks against American forces this year.

headline.main: 6 American Soldiers Killed in Taliban Attack in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 6 From U.S. Military Are Killed in Taliban Suicide Bombing in Afghanistan

snippet: A Taliban suicide bomber on a motorcycle struck a patrol near Bagram Air Base, in one of the deadliest attacks against American forces this year.
